statement.p: Determine the slope of the contour lines of the function \displaystyle{f{{\left({x},{y}\right)}}}= \displaystyle{3}+{2}{x}-{2}{y}. Enter your answer as an integer or a reduced fraction.

solution.p: A contour line for \displaystyle{f{{\left({x},{y}\right)}}} has the form \displaystyle{c}= \displaystyle{3}+{2}{x}-{2}{y} for some constant \displaystyle{c}.
So the slope for any value of \displaystyle{c} will be \displaystyle{1}.
